intro: Austrobassia luehmannii, commonly known as the Luehmann's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant traits. Austrobassia luehmannii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
